Description: Mould-made pottery lamp-holder in the form of a circular shrine with a loop suspension handle above. The front has a square opening for the lamp, gabled above. The roof of the shrine is decorated with leaves, wave patterns and raised points. The rear of the shrine is decorated with maeanders in a rectangular panel, and has a lozenge-shaped hole. The floor of the lamp-holder is concave below, and stands on three short rounded feet. Covered with a red slip, except for the underside and interior.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q609.bis)
